page.title: 15STISTED AND STISTED HALL
page.content: The small village of Stisted lies on the eastern edge of the area surrounded by open countryside. The houses are a mixture of old and new.Overlooking the village is Stisted Hall which is now an old people's home. The Hall has retained all the charm of its previous private ownership. Set amid extensive grounds it has an imposing entrance leading to a double stairway. Immediately above the stairway is a beautiful domed ceiling window surrounded by decorative pink stucco plasterwork. The residents dining room is oak panelled and airy. The grounds contain many trees shrubs and plants and an ornamental fish pond.
